c74object.name: 264.sfplay~
c74object.digest: Load and play soundfiles from disk via a graphical interface.
c74object.description: Combines soundfile loading, playback, volume, and speed controls in a simple graphical interface.

inlet.description: Sets the volume of soundfile playback. Floats are understood as absolute values in terms of amplitude (0.–1.). Integers are understood as a MIDI range (0–127) and mapped to the float range.

Set how fast the file is played back. Floats are understood as absolute values (-4.–4.), e.g. 0.5 = half speed; 1. = normal speed; 2. = double speed. Negative values play the file backwards, e.g. -2. = double speed backwards. Integers are understood as a MIDI range (0–127) and mapped to the float range.

Sets which file should be played back. Must match the name of an audio file in your soundfiles folder. File names must include one of the following extensions: .wav; .wave; .aif; or .aiff. File names should not include spaces. For best results stick to upper- and lowercase letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores.

c74object.discussion: Used in a bpatcher, 264.sfplay~ provides a graphical interface to load and play soundfiles from your hard drive, including controls for volume and speed. Connect to your MIDI controller by clicking on the 264.midi-learn arrows.
